{"step_by_step_thinking": "The woman needs medical help for her newborn child who is showing symptoms of illness. The JSSK (Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram) is a national health programme in India that provides free and cashless services to pregnant women and sick newborns up to 30 days after birth. This includes free drugs and consumables, free diagnostics, free blood wherever required, and free diet during stay in the health institutions. This program also provides for free transport from home to health institutions. Therefore, this program would be the most suitable for the woman's situation.", "answer_choice": "A. JSSK"}
